Manager Architecture & Infrastructure Tracking Code 304146-618 Job Description Working in a fast-paced, mission-critical environment, the Manager, Infrastructure & Architecture is responsible for designing and maintaining the IT infrastructure of a high-availability, 24x7 electronic payments network and INTERAC member
This position is for a 1 year contract.
Specific Responsibilities Include:
Administer Hardware, Operating Systems, and Logical Security in the Production Data Centre Design solutions and Implement changes to Hardware, Operating Systems, and IT security utilizing various technologies and in compliance with PCI standards Oversight of LAN/WAN administration via management of Network Analysts Provide leadership and guidance to internal teams and customers on infrastructure technologies Produce required documentation including technical specifications, procedures, infrastructure and network schematics, etc. Investigate and implement tools to aid in automation, improve performance, and track critical metrics Research and recommend new technologies and champion them within current business infrastructure Understand business goals and requirements of Open Solutions customers Conduct performance reviews, grow expertise of the team, prepare team to meet new business requirements Administer Backup management and recovery planning Project management and team lead on various projects 24x7 Pager Support Required Skills Required Skills:
University degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science ITIL V2 ICT Infrastructure Management Certificate or equivalent Minimum 7 years hands-on experience designing, building, and supporting complex IT infrastructures including LAN, WAN, SSL, and VPN architectures Minimum 5 years management experience Minimum 3 years experience supporting high-availability, mission-critical Data Centre operations Formal Project management training - PMI certification an asset Hands-on experience with Disaster Recovery Operations and Incident Management Knowledge of SOX, PCI, and/or other IT-related controls and standards Technical Proficiency with theory, practices, and tools of: Common Operating Systems (e.g., Windows, HP-UX, Linux) VMWare LAN/WAN Enterprise Networking products (e.g., Cisco Routers, F5 BigIP). Network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, VPN) HP EVA/SAN Microsoft Active Directory In-depth knowledge of: High-Availability Data Centre environment Disaster Recovery environments Strong human relation skills with a positive attitude and strong work ethic Proven Analytical and Problem-solving skills with strong priority management skills Outstanding Documentation and Verbal Communication skills
Job Location Oakville, ONT, CANADA Position Type Temporary
